resources.string: Launch a Standard Notification with a notification\'s \"action\". This action will send a browse intent with the url of the Notification docs on developer.android.com. \n\nIt will both be displayed on the phone and on the wear device as a standard notification.

Sometimes you have extra text you want to display in your notification. This can be done to add a style to your notification. In this case we will use a BigTextStyle style to show a bigger notification.
This is a notification with a BigStyle style.
This is a notification with an extra large area to show more text. This is useful when you need to provide the user with more information in your notification.

Launch a Notification with an additional action. The normal action will be to browse to an URL, but there will be an extra option to see a place on a map. \n\nThe extra action will be displayed on both the phone and on the wear device.
This is a notification with an extra action. The action will open a location on a map.
This is called: Simple Extended Wearable Notification

This is a notification that has extra actions that are different on the phone and wearable. On the phone the action will be to show the location on the map, on the wearable we will have the action to navigate directly to the location.

When you\'d like to provide more information without requiring users to open your app on their handheld device, you can add one or more pages to the notification on the wearable. The additional pages appear immediately to the right of the main notification card.
This is a notification with Pager functionality.
This is an extra page that shows extra information that would not fit in a normal notification on the wearable device.
